q: It's just a bad day, not a bad life.
h:
“It's just a bad day, not a bad life.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: Laws are like cobwebs, which may catch small flies, but let wasps and hornets break through.
h:
“Laws are like cobwebs, which may catch small flies, but let wasps and hornets break through.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: As one grows weaker one is less susceptible to suffering. There is less hurt because there is less to hurt.
h:
“As one grows weaker one is less susceptible to suffering. There is less hurt because there is less to hurt.” —
Jack London

q: Success is the progressive realization of a worthy goal or ideal.
h:
“Success is the progressive realization of a worthy goal or ideal.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Many people spend more time looking at their failures than focusing on their successes.
h:
“Many people spend more time looking at their failures than focusing on their successes.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.
h:
“However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: Men trust their ears less than their eyes.
h:
“Men trust their ears less than their eyes.” —
Herodotus

q: Do not pray for an easy life, pray for the strength to endure a difficult one.
h:
“Do not pray for an easy life, pray for the strength to endure a difficult one. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: I think self-awareness is probably the most important thing towards being a champion.
h:
“I think self-awareness is probably the most important thing towards being a champion. ” —
Billie Jean King

q: Perhaps the most tragic thing about mankind is that we are all dreaming about some magical garden over the horizon, instead of enjoying the roses that are right outside today.
h:
“Perhaps the most tragic thing about mankind is that we are all dreaming about some magical garden over the horizon, instead of enjoying the roses that are right outside today.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: We suffer for the simple reason that suffering is biologically useful. It is nature's preferred agent for inspiring change.
h:
“We suffer for the simple reason that suffering is biologically useful. It is nature's preferred agent for inspiring change.” —
Mark Manson

q: Lost Time is never found again.
h:
“Lost Time is never found again.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: If you do not conquer self, you will be conquered by self.
h:
“If you do not conquer self, you will be conquered by self.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: If you want something new, you have to stop doing something old.
h:
“If you want something new, you have to stop doing something old.” —
Peter Drucker

q: Peace is letting it be. Letting life flow, letting emotions flow through you.
h:
“Peace is letting it be. Letting life flow, letting emotions flow through you.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Follow your instincts. That is where true wisdom manifests itself.
h:
“Follow your instincts. That is where true wisdom manifests itself.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Just as true humor is laughter at oneself, true humanity is knowledge of oneself.
h:
“Just as true humor is laughter at oneself, true humanity is knowledge of oneself.” —
Alan Watts

q: Trust your instincts: my first reaction is almost invariably the right one.
h:
“Trust your instincts: my first reaction is almost invariably the right one. ” —
Estee Lauder

q: An inch of time is an inch of gold but you can't buy that inch of time with an inch of gold.
h:
“An inch of time is an inch of gold but you can't buy that inch of time with an inch of gold.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Often we pass beside happiness without seeing it, without looking at it, or even if we have seen and looked at it, without recognizing it.
h:
“Often we pass beside happiness without seeing it, without looking at it, or even if we have seen and looked at it, without recognizing it.” —
Alexandre Dumas

q: There's no scarcity of opportunity to make a living at what you love. There is only a scarcity of resolve to make it happen.
h:
“There's no scarcity of opportunity to make a living at what you love. There is only a scarcity of resolve to make it happen.” —
Wayne Dyer

q: Lying can never save us from another lie.
h:
“Lying can never save us from another lie.” —
Vaclav Havel

q: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
h:
“Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.” —
Helen Keller

q: Life can be wonderful if you're not afraid of it.
h:
“Life can be wonderful if you're not afraid of it.” —
Charlie Chaplin

q: Nothing is impossible. The word itself says 'I'm possible!'
h:
“Nothing is impossible. The word itself says 'I'm possible!'” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: Character is the result of two things: mental attitude and the way we spend our time.
h:
“Character is the result of two things: mental attitude and the way we spend our time.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: If you set your goals ridiculously high and its a failure, you will fail above everyone elses success.
h:
“If you set your goals ridiculously high and its a failure, you will fail above everyone elses success.” —
James Cameron

q: Adventure is worthwhile in itself.
h:
“Adventure is worthwhile in itself.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
h:
“Quality is not an act, it is a habit.” —
Aristotle

q: Muddy water is best cleared by leaving it alone.
h:
“Muddy water is best cleared by leaving it alone.” —
Alan Watts

q: You are never too old to become younger.
h:
“You are never too old to become younger.” —
Mae West

q: The highest level of wisdom is when you not only accept but love adversity.
h:
“The highest level of wisdom is when you not only accept but love adversity.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: Fashion fades, only style remains the same.
h:
“Fashion fades, only style remains the same.” —
Coco Chanel

q: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.
h:
“Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.” —
Walt Whitman

q: The more often a stupidity is repeated, the more it gets the appearance of wisdom.
h:
“The more often a stupidity is repeated, the more it gets the appearance of wisdom.” —
Voltaire

q: Not everything that weighs you down is yours to carry.
h:
“Not everything that weighs you down is yours to carry.” —
Unknown

q: Find something you love and do it better than everyone else.
h:
“Find something you love and do it better than everyone else.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
h:
“A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.” —
Lao Tzu

q: No snowflake ever falls in the wrong place.
h:
“No snowflake ever falls in the wrong place.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Every day passes whether you participate or not.
h:
“Every day passes whether you participate or not.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Intelligence, imagination, and knowledge are essential resources, but only effectiveness converts them into results.
h:
“Intelligence, imagination, and knowledge are essential resources, but only effectiveness converts them into results.” —
Peter Drucker

q: Stop being a prisoner of your past. Become the architect of your future.
h:
“Stop being a prisoner of your past. Become the architect of your future.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Don't try to be young. Just open your mind. Stay interested in stuff.
h:
“Don't try to be young. Just open your mind. Stay interested in stuff.” —
Betty White

q: By changing nothing, nothing changes.
h:
“By changing nothing, nothing changes.” —
Celestine Chua

q: To be fully alive is to feel that everything is possible.
h:
“To be fully alive is to feel that everything is possible.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Either you choose to stay in the shallow end of the pool or you go out into the ocean.
h:
“Either you choose to stay in the shallow end of the pool or you go out into the ocean.” —
Christopher Reeve

q: Making money isn't hard in itself... What's hard is to earn it doing something worth devoting one's life to.
h:
“Making money isn't hard in itself... What's hard is to earn it doing something worth devoting one's life to.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Lack of emotion causes lack of progress and lack of motivation.
h:
“Lack of emotion causes lack of progress and lack of motivation.” —
Tony Robbins

q: We ordinary people must forge our own beauty.
h:
“We ordinary people must forge our own beauty.” —
Kenji Miyazawa

q: One always begins to forgive a place as soon as it's left behind.
h:
“One always begins to forgive a place as soon as it's left behind.” —
Charles Dickens
